translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with the Teaching as its Basis
The Story of the Elder Sakosakakoraṇḍadāyaka
Seeing the footprint of the One with Ten Powers,
of the Lion of the Sakyans, the Kinsman of the Sun,
I put my outer robe over one shoulder
and worshipped the Best of Feet.
and worshipped the Wheel-mark on the feet.
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the feet.
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the elder Sakosakakoraṇḍadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sakosakakoraṇḍadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Sakosakakoraṇḍadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sakosakakoraṇḍadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽sakosaka koraṇḍadāyaka therassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Story of the Elder Sakosakakoraṇḍadāyaka is the fourth.
